main.name: Nithin Pingili
main.bio: I am a Frontend Developer at Anica and currently working on a property management website. I have experience with full-stack web development using technologies such as React, Redux, Node.js, Express, and SQL. Also, I have deployed the full-stack web applications on Amazon Web Services using Docker and GitLab CI/CD pipelines. I have a strong inclination towards building delightful user interfaces using modern frontend technologies. At Anica, I improved the usability of the property management web application by implementing responsive layouts that work across all modern browsers and devices.
main.contactmessage: If you have any questions regarding my work or if you think there is an opportunity available for me, please contact me using the form below.

education.school: The University of Texas at Austin
education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
education.description: Coursework: Algorithms, Cloud Computing, Computer Architecture, Computer Networks, Data Structures, Modern Web Applications, Operating Systems, Software Engineering, Computer Security, Data Mining

work.title: Anica Inc.
work.description: Collaborated with UI/UX designers and backend developers to build a single-page web application for property management that allows landlords and real estate professionals to track leases, residents, and maintenance tasks as well as collect rent and manage finances to reduce costs and streamline operations. The web application consumes RESTful web services and provides a seamless user experience.

projects.title: Trading Cards
projects.category: A web application for Yu-Gi-Oh! Trading Cards

projects.title: Food Me Once
projects.category: Website designed to look into the issue of food security in the United States
